title: French furniture brand Roche Bobois - and its iconic Mah Jong sofa - gets a touch of Portuguese flair
text:
Roche Bobois describes its offerings as art de vivre, or the art of living. But we Anglo Saxons would probably call it fancy French furniture. Its showrooms - there is one in London on Finchley Road - are riots of colour and rich fabric brought to life by designers including Jean Nouvel and Marcel Wanders.

The company was created when two leading Parisian furniture families went to the Copenhagen Salon in 1960 to look into the exciting possibilities of Scandinavian design, and instead formed a partnership specialising in French chic.

Roche Bobois has always taken a catholic approach to finding new designers. In 2010, it teamed up with Jean Paul Gaultier, who dressed a sofa in his trademark matelot...
description: Roche Bobois describes its offerings as art de vivre, or the art of living.
